首里城遺産構成、基壇の一部損傷か…火災原因は電気トラブル有力

06 Nov 2019, 13:23



地下の遺構が見れるようにガラス張りになっていた焼失前の首里城正殿の床下（一般財団法人沖縄美ら島財団提供）

　首里城の火災で、那覇市消防局は６日、電気系統のトラブルを有力な出火原因とみていると発表した。火元とみられる正殿の北東部分からは、内部が焦げた電気設備が見つかっており、沖縄県警や同局は実況見分を続け、関連を調べている。
　沖縄美ら島財団は同日、警備員らが最後に正殿に立ち入ったのが１０月３１日午前１時２０分頃だったとしてきたのは誤りで、同３０日午後９時３５分だったと発表した。財団職員が正殿から出た後、警備員がシャッターを閉めたのが最後という。
　財団などは火災後初めて現場の写真も公開。多くの建物が焼失した中で、琉球国王の象徴とされる龍をかたどった正殿前の柱は焼け残っていた。
　県教育委員会によると、世界文化遺産「琉球王国のグスク及び関連遺産群」の構成資産である基壇（きだん）（土台）の一部が損傷した可能性がある。基壇などの遺構は全焼した正殿の地中にあるが、露出させてガラス越しに公開していた部分（縦約７メートル、横約５メートル）にがれきが入り込んだという。同教委は、ごく小規模であることから、世界遺産としての価値への影響は少ないとみている。
　玉城デニー知事は、沖縄の本土復帰から５０年となる２０２２年５月までに再建計画の策定を目指す考えを示している。

Shuri Castle heritage structure, partial damage of the foundation ... The cause of the fire is an electrical trouble

06 Nov 2019, 13:23



Under the floor of Shurijo Castle Masanori, which was glazed so that the underground remains can be seen (provided by Okinawa Churashima Foundation)

In the Shuri Castle fire, the Naha City Fire Department announced on the 6th that the trouble of the electric system was considered as a major cause of fire. From the northeastern part of the main shrine, which seems to be the source of fire, an electrical facility with a burnt interior has been found, and the Okinawa Prefectural Police and the same station continue to see the actual situation and investigate the relationship.
On the same day, the Okinawa Churashima Foundation announced that it was an error that the guards last entered the main hall at around 1:20 am on October 31, and it was 9:35 pm on the same day. did. It is said that the security guards closed the shutter after Foundation personnel left the main hall.
The foundations and others will also release photos of the site for the first time after the fire. While many buildings were burnt down, the pillars in front of the main shrine, which was shaped like a dragon, the symbol of the Ryukyu king, remained unburned.
According to the prefectural Board of Education, there is a possibility that part of the foundation (base), which is a component of the world cultural heritage “Gusuku and related heritage of the Ryukyu Kingdom”, has been damaged. The ruins, such as the foundation, are in the ground of the main building that has been completely burnt down, but debris has entered the exposed part (about 7 meters long and about 5 meters wide) exposed through the glass. Since the faculty is very small, it has little impact on its value as a World Heritage site.
Governor Tamaki Denney has expressed his intention to establish a reconstruction plan by May 2022, 50 years after the return of Okinawa to the mainland.
